text: Brickellia vernicosa is a Mexican species of flowering plants in the daisy family. It is native to north-central Mexico, in the states of Durango, Zacatecas, and Chihuahua.Turner, B. L. 1997. The Comps of Mexico: A systematic account of the family Asteraceae, vol. 1 – Eupatorieae. Phytologia Memoirs 11: i–iv, 1–272 Brickellia vernicosa is a shrub with striped bark and violet flower heads.Robinson, Benjamin Lincoln 1901. Proceedings of the American Academy of Arts and Sciences 36(26): 487 ==References== ==External links== *Photo of herbarium specimen at Missouri Botanical Garden, collected in Durango, isotype of Brickellia vernicosa vernicosa Category:Flora of Durango Category:Flora of Zacatecas Chihuahua Category:Plants described in 1901
title: Brickellia vernicosa
